sentence.text: Squamous cell carcinoma (negative regulation of peptidase activity) can progress to malignant metastatic cancer, including an aggressive subtype known as spindle cell carcinoma (spSCC). spSCC formation involves epithelial-to-mesenchymal transition (cytokine production), yet the molecular basis of this event remains unknown.

Here, we show that human spnegative regulation of peptidase activity tumours also feature strong nuclear localisation of regulation of cell cycle and overexpression of activated YAP (NLS-YAP-5SA) with Keratin-5 (K5-CreERt) is sufficient to induce rapid formation of both SCC and spSCC in apoptotic process.

spnegative regulation of peptidase activity tumours arise at sites of epithelial scratch wounding, where tumour-initiating epithelial cells undergo cytokine production to generate spnegative regulation of peptidase activity.
